question.title: Will Glenn Youngkin be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Glenn Youngkin is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

In this scenario, I am tasked with estimating the probabilities of several related events concerning Elon Musk's potential attendance and statements regarding Bitcoin at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024 conference and other events in 2024. 

1. **P (Elon Musk shows up at Bitcoin Nashville 2024)**: This event is significant as it involves a high-profile individual at a major event. Given Musk's previous involvement in the cryptocurrency space and the nature of the event, I estimate a moderate probability of 0.65 for this event occurring.

2. **not_P (Elon Musk not showing up at Bitcoin Nashville 2024)**: Since this is the complement of P, I estimate this probability at 0.35 (1 - 0.65).

3. **para_P (Is it possible that Elon Musk will attend Bitcoin Nashville 2024?)**: This question is similar to P, and given the context, I estimate it to be the same as P, so I will assign it a probability of 0.65.

4. **Q (Elon Musk making a public statement about Bitcoin at any event in 2024)**: Given Musk's active engagement with Bitcoin and the likelihood of him discussing it at some point in 2024, I estimate this probability to be 0.70.

5. **P_and_Q (Both P and Q occurring)**: For this compound event, I will estimate it as the product of the individual probabilities, considering they might be somewhat independent. Therefore, P_and_Q = P * Q = 0.65 * 0.70 = 0.455.

6. **P_or_Q (Either P or Q occurring)**: This can be calculated using the formula P_or_Q = P + Q - P_and_Q. Thus, P_or_Q = 0.65 + 0.70 - 0.455 = 0.895.

7. **Q_and_not_P (Q occurring while not_P occurs)**: This is a more complex event, and I will estimate it at a lower probability since it requires Musk to make a statement while not attending the conference. I will estimate this at 0.20.

8. **Q_given_P (Q occurring given that P occurs)**: This conditional probability is likely to be higher than Q alone, as attending the conference may lead to more statements. I will estimate this at 0.80.

Overall, these estimates are interrelated, and I will ensure they adhere to the consistency rules provided. The independence of events P and Q is assumed for the calculations, but I will check the final estimates against the consistency rules to ensure they hold true.

question.title: Will Larry Elder be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Given Larry Elder is the Republican nominee, will Glenn Youngkin also be the nominee?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Then, is Glenn Youngkin also selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Resolution criteria: The question resolves as YES if Glenn Youngkin is indeed selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, despite Larry Elder also being selected. It resolves as NO if Glenn Youngkin is not selected. Note that this scenario is logically inconsistent under typical single-nominee conditions.

question.title: Given that Larry Elder is not the Republican nominee, will Glenn Youngkin be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Larry Elder is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This means that any other candidate is selected. Then, is Glenn Youngkin selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? 

Resolution criteria: 
- The condition is met if Larry Elder is not selected as the nominee by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.
- The outcome resolves as **Yes** if Glenn Youngkin is selected as the nominee by the delegates of the Republican National Convention. All other candidates will resolve as **No**.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

1. **P (Will Elon Musk show up at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024?)**: This event is likely influenced by Musk's history with Bitcoin and his public persona. Given the significance of the event and Musk's previous engagements, I estimate a moderate probability of him attending, say around 0.65.

2. **not_P (Will Elon Musk not show up at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024?)**: This is simply the complement of P, which would be approximately 0.35.

3. **para_P (Is it possible that Elon Musk will attend the Bitcoin Nashville 2024?)**: This question is similar to P, so I expect it to have a similar probability, likely around 0.65 as well.

4. **Q (Will Elon Musk make a public statement about Bitcoin at any event in 2024?)**: Given Musk's active engagement with Bitcoin and the cryptocurrency community, I would estimate this probability to be relatively high, perhaps around 0.75.

5. **P_and_Q (Will both P and Q occur?)**: This probability depends on both P and Q occurring simultaneously. Assuming some correlation between attending the event and making a statement about Bitcoin, I might estimate this around 0.50.

6. **P_or_Q (Will either P or Q occur?)**: This probability would be higher than both individual probabilities since it covers both events. Using the formula for the union of two events, I can estimate this around 0.85.

7. **Q_and_not_P (Will both Q occur and not P occur?)**: This is less likely since if Musk makes a statement about Bitcoin, it could be at the Nashville event. I would estimate this probability to be lower, perhaps around 0.20.

8. **Q_given_P (Given P, will Q occur?)**: If Musk shows up at the Nashville event, the likelihood of him making a public statement about Bitcoin increases. Thus, I might estimate this probability to be higher, around 0.80.

After estimating these probabilities, I will need to check against the consistency rules to ensure that they are logically coherent. The consistency rules will help confirm that the relationships between these events are accurately represented in my estimates.

question.title: Conditional on Kamala's odds of winning increasing over the next week, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Kamala Harris's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model. Specifically, this means that the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is greater than 46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM. 

Then, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves as Yes if, prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive. If such a statement is not made by the deadline, this resolves as No.

Given his past involvement in Bitcoin discussions, I estimate a moderate probability of around 0.65.

2. **not_P (Elon Musk does not show up at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024)**: This is simply the complement of P, which would be 0.35 based on the estimate of P.

3. **para_P (Is it possible that Elon Musk will attend the Bitcoin Nashville 2024?)**: This question is closely related to P, and I expect it to have a similar probability, also around 0.65.

4. **Q (Elon Musk makes a public statement about Bitcoin at any event in 2024)**: Given Musk's active engagement with Bitcoin and the likelihood of him discussing it at various events, I estimate this probability to be around 0.70.

5. **P_and_Q (Both P and Q occur)**: The probability of both events happening simultaneously would be lower than either event alone. I estimate this at 0.45, considering some independence but also recognizing that if he shows up, he is likely to make a statement.

6. **P_or_Q (Either P or Q occurs)**: This probability should be higher than either individual event. I estimate this at 0.80, considering the likelihood of at least one of these events happening.

7. **Q_and_not_P (Q occurs while P does not)**: This scenario is possible if Musk makes a public statement but does not attend the event. I estimate this probability at around 0.25.

8. **Q_given_P (Given P, will Q occur?)**: If Musk shows up at the event, the likelihood that he will make a statement about Bitcoin is likely high. I estimate this at around 0.85.

In summary, I expect a strong correlation between P and Q, with both being influenced by Musk's public engagement with Bitcoin. I will ensure that the probabilities are consistent with the rules provided.

question.title: Given Kamala's odds of winning do not increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Kamala's odds of winning do not increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model. This resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is <=46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

Then is it true that Joe Biden will announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves the same as the original on Metaculus. 

Resolution criteria for Biden's announcement: This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.
